benchmark_details.name: Hallucinations Leaderboard
benchmark_details.overview: An open initiative to quantitatively measure and compare the tendency of large language models (LLMs) to produce hallucinations across various tasks such as question-answering, summarisation, and reading comprehension.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To guide researchers and practitioners in choosing reliable models by providing insights into the hallucination tendencies of different LLMs.
tasks: Evaluate factuality and faithfulness of model outputs

data.source: Various datasets for evaluating LLMs including Natural Questions, TriviaQA, XSum, CNN/DM among others.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are averaged to produce factuality and faithfulness scores.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better adherence to factuality and faithfulness in the model outputs.
methodology.validation: Evaluation framework based on the EleutherAI Language Model Evaluation Harness.
